meanings.definition: The act or process of dulling or blunting.
meanings.sent1: The hebetations of the knife made it difficult to cut through the tough meat.
meanings.sent2: After hours of sanding, the hebetations of the blade were evident.
meanings.sent3: The hebetations of the pencil tip caused the artist to create blurry lines.
meanings.sent4: The hebetations of the mind dulled his once sharp wit.
meanings.sent5: The hebetations of the tool were a hindrance to the carpenter's work.

meanings.definition: A state of being dull or blunt.
meanings.sent1: The hebetations of the old scissors made it hard to cut paper smoothly.
meanings.sent2: His hebetations after a long day at work made him uninterested in conversation.
meanings.sent3: The hebetations of the pencil tip were no match for the sharpener.
meanings.sent4: The hebetations of the blade were a reminder of its frequent use.
meanings.sent5: The hebetations of the tool were noticeable after years of wear and tear.
